nodes.text: A crest was used as a personal symbol by the Grand Master of the Jedi Order Yoda. This crest was placed on the door to his quarters in the Jedi Temple on Coruscant. It also seen on some of the furniture within his quarters, carved into some of the exterior walls of the Jedi Temple, and on a wing of his personal starfighter.

Yoda's crest was designed by conceptual artist Philip Metschan for Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones. In the 1994 novel The Courtship of Princess Leia, Luke Skywalker was given a stone box adorned with "the two glyphs that spelled Yoda's name". The emblem drawn by Metschan also featured two glyphs at the center of the crest.
